summary: This document is an email chain from September 2019 regarding the 'taint review' process for materials seized from Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan residence. It discusses the status of the review, the release of non-privileged (NP) documents, and coordination with Epstein's attorneys regarding search terms to identify privileged material.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; materials were seized from his Manhattan residence. His attorneys were involved in the taint review process.

persons.name: Ori
persons.role: Correspondent / Possibly Law Enforcement or Legal Staff
persons.context: An active participant in the email chain, providing updates and instructions regarding the taint review and release of documents.

connections.description: Ori is involved in the legal process (taint review) concerning materials seized from Epstein's residence, coordinating with Epstein's attorneys.

events.title: Materials from Epstein's residence made available
events.description: Materials seized from Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan residence were made available for review.

events.title: Release of Non-Privileged (NP) documents
events.description: Confirmation that there was no agreement with Epstein's estate lawyers, allowing the release of non-privileged documents from the seized materials.

keyFacts: A 'taint review' was conducted on materials seized from Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan residence to identify privileged attorney-client communications.
Epstein's attorneys provided search terms (lawyer/paralegal names) to aid in segregating potentially privileged material during the review.
By September 26, 2019, non-privileged (NP) documents were released for review by investigators, as no agreement with Epstein's estate lawyers required prior notice.
The email chain indicates ongoing coordination between investigators and Epstein's legal team regarding the handling of seized evidence after his death.
